title: Alpha Clients CPU/Memory Usage :(

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body: So on my laptop (I'm a student who is not trying to invest in a desktop simply to play a game), the new client takes up so much and basically lags slightly when up from taking so much resources to operate. So I wouldn't be able to do much multitasking with it open. When in-game using the new client, it is better if I close the client and leave only the game open otherwise I get fps lag from it trying to run the client and game together. Which means I would be relogging after every game. If this is going to be the new client, will it be closing like the current client does majority of the time and reopening at the end of matches? I love the new look but damn, I'm sacrificing a lot of resources when I personally care more about the gameplay than how I am getting into the game.

replies.body: You are in our minds. Ideally the client would shutdown automatically when a game starts and start up again when the game ends. It is not there yet, but we want that just as much as you do. Give us some time! Thanks for testing the Alpha!

That's all well and good for actually jumping into a game, but what about its absurdly high CPU usage at all times regardless of client state?

When I have the client minimized, or finding a match, or whatever else, the CPU usage is always high, so I can't exactly have the chromium client running like I do with the air client. (air client sits at at around 2-1% cpu usage, where the league chromium alpha client is constantly anywhere from 40% minimum to 98%)

Is your current plan only to reduce CPU usage when the game is launched by suspending the interface process, or to reduce CPU usage down to par with the air client AND suspend it during matches?

the plan is to reduce CPU usage down to par with the air client, regardless of the shutdown feature

I'm also having this issue, I have a 4690k @ 4.4GHz and it uses 10 percent of the cpu when idle and 20 percent or more when joining a match, this stops my pc from downclocking and is a waste of power, if it's still like this when the client goes public the collective electricity waste will be insane.
